unnormalised: A new rule is coming into effect requring all students appearing for their 10th and 12th board exams to link their Aadhaar no. with their school registration ID. The circular released by the CBSE yesterday states that this is to curb proxy students. Schools have been asked to collect the Aadhar details by 30/09/2024.
normalised: A new rule is coming into effect requiring all students appearing for their tenth and twelfth board exams to link their Aadhaar number with their school registration I-D. The circular released by the C-B-S-E yesterday states that this is to curb proxy students. Schools have been asked to collect the Aadhaar details by thirtieth September two thousand and twenty four.

unnormalised: This decision follows a similar directive from the Ministry of Education, asking all universities to maintain a database of student IDs and link them to the student's UIDAI (Aadhaar). The goal is to improve transparency and prevent impersonation during exams. Students are requested to submit copies of their Aadhaar cards along with their enrolment forms to their respective institutions at the earliest, so officials said.
normalised: This decision follows a similar directive from the Ministry of Education, asking all universities to maintain a database of student I-Ds and link them to the student's U-I-D-A-I (Aadhaar). The goal is to improve transparency and prevent impersonation during exams. Students are requested to submit copies of their Aadhaar cards along with their enrolment forms to their respective institutions at the earliest, so officials said.
